label.text: Lunar Issues
There is a wide belief among many people today that the full moon affects human health.
This belief has persisted for hundreds, if not thousands, of years.
So far, scientific evidence does not support this belief.
Full moon and clouds
Lunar Issues
In a scientific journal, a study of 17,966 people treated in hospitals was reported.
The study identified no connection between human health and the full moon.
Lunar Issues
Claiming that there is a link between the full moon and human health is an example of pseudoscience. This is because the claim has been shown not to be true using scientific methods.
Pseudoscience claims may arise from research based on a faulty premise, flawed experimental design or poor-quality data.
In which one of these sources would you seek scientific evidence of a link between the full moon and changes in human moods?
in reports published in the daily newspapers
in articles written for peer-reviewed medical journals
in the historical records of medical healers and philosophers
in the personal observations of people published on the internet
There could be many reasons that people still believe the moon affects human health.
One hypothesis is that a person’s beliefs are linked to their level of education.
Suggest two groups of adults that could be surveyed to test this hypothesis.
